main_definition: A device used to record and play back video cassettes containing analog or digital content.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Video Cassette Recorder (VCR) - A device that can record audio-visual content onto magnetic tape
meanings_and_examples.example: In the 1980s, people used VCRs to watch movies at home from their own videotapes.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A specific type of software for managing video files on a computer
meanings_and_examples.example: I installed VCR software on my computer so I could easily edit and play back old home videos.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An abbreviation used in digital audio workstations (DAWs) to refer to the 'Video Clip Render' feature
meanings_and_examples.example: I used the VCR function on my DAW software to apply video effects to a specific segment of an audio track.
